Message:
A world buried beneath
a storm of sand.
That was the sight I awoke to—

the land parched to dust,
its cities consumed
by the amassing dunes...

I had no way of knowing if
anyone else had even survived...

Not long after, I was saved
by a man wielding a staff
and his companions.

They filled me in
on everything
that had transpired.

“We should not have met...
If she had not met me...
Ayse would be...!”

Among the raging
tempest winds,
I could hear
Liberia’s voice.

They were howls of
denial and longing—
the strangled cries
of my dearest friend...

We shouldn’t have met, huh...?
I suppose that’s true...
But, if I hadn’t met you...

I would have been
nothing more than
a boring researcher,
who rejects everyone and
everything different from me.

I never thought about
how your people felt...

No...that still hasn’t changed.
I didn’t understand you at all.
Like how you’d feel
being left behind...

So, I want you to teach me
even more about you, Liberia.
I’ll teach you more
about myself, too.

The two of us meeting
wasn’t a mistake.

What heals the scars
on our hearts, filling the void
that loneliness leaves,

is the warmth from knowing
someone is willing to bridge
the gap to understand us.

If you’re in pain right now,
I’ll bridge the gap between us
to understand the pain
in your heart.

You changed me,
and made me your friend...

so that’s something
only I can do.
Right...Liberia...?
